summary: Based on the provided documents, Bayard Rustin is mentioned in the context of FBI investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents primarily consist of memoranda summarizing the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) in 1975. While Rustin's specific role or actions are not detailed in these summaries, his name appears alongside those of King, the SCLC, and Levison, suggesting some level of association or relevance to the investigations being discussed. The documents focus on electronic surveillance, potential communist influence, and the FBI's operational policies during that period. There is no direct mention of the JFK assassination in relation to Bayard Rustin within these documents.
